intro: Ouratea tuerckheimii, commonly known as the velvetleaf ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its common name. The flowers are usually white or pink, with five petals and a prominent yellow or green center, making it a visually appealing ornamental plant.
